net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.content

Class SQLiteHouseRelay

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.content.SQLiteHouseRelay

  • public class SQLiteHouseRelay
extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver
    A class which can send requests to, and receive notifications from, a SQLiteHouseKeeper. This class fills the role of a ContentResolver without implementing that class's API, since the prototypes of the ContentResolver's methods don't fit with the workflow of a SQLiteHouse. If an app uses an implementation of SQLiteHouse to marshal data to/from a SQLite database, then it should provide a library which includes the schematic classes and an implementation of this class. Since the implementation class is expected to be provided in a library that is separate from the SQLiteHouse implementation, its declaration must not depend on the ability to import that implementation (e.g. as part of a generic template parameter on the class).
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.7 (#50)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SQLiteHouseRelay.Listener
      Methods that must be implemented by any class that wants to process the information received in signals from a SQLiteHouseKeeper.

      • register

        public SQLiteHouseRelay register(SQLiteHouseSignalAPI api)
        Registers the relay instance as a BroadcastReceiver in its context.
        Parameters:
        api - the signal contract between the keeper and the relay; if null, then the relay will be unregistered instead

        (fluid)

      • addListener

        public SQLiteHouseRelay addListener(SQLiteHouseRelay.Listener l)
        Registers a listener. The method is idempotent; if the same listener is passed multiple times, then it will be added only if it is not already present.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to be registered
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • removeListener

        public SQLiteHouseRelay removeListener(SQLiteHouseRelay.Listener l)
        Unregisters a listener. The method is idempotent; if the same listener is passed multiple times, then it will be removed only if it is still present.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to be removed
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • handleCustomAction

        protected void handleCustomAction(android.content.Context ctx,
                                  android.content.Intent sig,
                                  java.lang.String sToken)
        Override this method to handle custom actions not covered by the standard set defined in SQLiteHouseSignalAPI. The default implementation writes an information log stating that the action is unrecognized.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context from which the signal originated
        sig - the received signal
        sToken - the action token parsed from the signal
